fullText: This brilliant reimagining of the Rodgers and Hammerstein classic is a knockout that feels both faithful to the original and completely fresh.

bwwExcerpt: Some of Fish's ideas are fun. The chili and cornbread doled out to the audience at intermission is tasty, and the women snapping ears of corn during "Many A New Day" gives the scene rebellious energy. But in putting his actors in modern dress, making guns his wallpaper and forcing every moment that ...
